content.raw:
I bet it found ignition-math3 instead. A lot of the ignition libraries currently `find_package(ignition-math3)`, which sets the variable `IGNITION_MATH_FOUND`, which causes `find_package(ignition-math4)` in this package to exit immediately, falsely believing it found version 4. You'll need to build every ignition library that depends on math from source, editing them to depend on 4. 

[This PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/178/make-cmake-variables-use-versioned-project/diff) fixes the issue by making the CMake variables match the project name.
content.html:
I bet it found ignition-math3 instead. A lot of the ignition libraries currently find_package(ignition-math3), which sets the variable IGNITION_MATH_FOUND, which causes find_package(ignition-math4) in this package to exit immediately, falsely believing it found version 4. You'll need to build every ignition library that depends on math from source, editing them to depend on 4.

This PR fixes the issue by making the CMake variables match the project name.
